flawed_nl_solution:
Out of every 5 berries, she eats 1, so only 5 strawberries - 1 strawberry = <<5-1=5>>5 strawberries go into the basket for each handful.
The basket holds 60 strawberries, so it will take 60 strawberries / 5 strawberries per handful = <<60/5=12>>12 handfuls to fill the basket.
So in total, Susan will pick 60 strawberries + 12 handfuls * 1 strawberry eaten per handful = <<60+12*1=72>>72 strawberries.
#### 72

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4, not 5. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
